data.title: *.atomic not being populated for Atom.io
Support external c/c++ code modules
data.body:
Currently the only way to integrate new C/C++ code into a project using AtomicGameEngine is by adding it to a custom engine build. It would be very helpful to have support for dynamically included libraries.

From the current engine source, it appears the appropriate way to do this would be to modify JSVM::js_module_search to load .dll (/.so/whatever per deployment platform) libraries and register their exposed methods to the duk_context. 

Some challenges here:
*While there is extensive discussion of a simple "standard" dynamic library loader for duktape [here](https://github.com/svaarala/duktape/issues/52) it doesn't seem to be available yet. Would likely need to be implemented from scratch.
*library loading and exposing would need implementation per platform
*would not be able to support this in iOS, perhaps a different approach would be in order-maybe introducing a requirement for static lib versions that could then be linked against when building the player?
*Current editor distribution does not include any headers for such libraries to include. Could the build process be modified to include headers for such plugin libraries to be able to make use of Atomic objects

data.title: Expose Log subsystem to JS as other subsystems
data.body: The Log subsystem is not currently exposed to JS as Input, etc.

data.title: AtomicEditor high CPU usage on Linux
data.body:
When I start the Editor on linux ( Linux 3.19.0-15-lowlatency #15-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT Fri Apr 17 00:03:20 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux ) it looks like it uses of 50 % of both my cores with no project loaded. It never recovers until I exit the IDE. Since it doesn't peg both cores I can still work, but it seems suspicious. I have to dig deeper. But here are some screenshots of the issue.
![screenshot_2015-05-01_12-55-04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/943437/7433664/b63ac440-f001-11e4-8b4b-d35815c27e3b.png)
![screenshot_2015-05-01_12-42-59](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/943437/7433669/bddc778e-f001-11e4-9611-bb770e77a7f2.png)
![screenshot_2015-05-01_12-44-35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/943437/7433677/c3a4c996-f001-11e4-8249-1812eca279bb.png)

data.title: Building to the same location in Windows 7 alternately succeeds and fails
data.body:
In the Windows version of the editor, on Windows 7:
*Ctrl-B to build
*Select a folder
*Click build->build succeeds
*Ctrl-B to build
*Select same folder
*Click build->previous build is deleted but new build is not generated
*Ctrl-B to build
*Select same folder
*Click build->build succeeds
Wash, rinse, repeat :)

data.body: console.log is often used to output to console, this should call the existing print function

data.title: JSBind tool is dependent on D3DCompiler_47.dll
data.body:
This causes a problem when the dll is not available, as is the case pre-Windows 8.

Remove this dependency!

data.title: Is there plan to make the source code 32bit ?
data.body:
currently the cmake support only 64bit on windows , is there any plan for 32bit?
Thanks

data.title: UI parser requires tabs for indentation
data.body:
It should probably error on a mixture of tabs and spaces, though spaces should also be possible to use.

Maybe JSON would be a better fit, however it is quite a bit more verbose.  Hand editing ui files is a good way of generating them, even once there is a dedicated UI editor.

data.title: Look into TBSection for Atomic Editor inspector collapsable regions
Fix controller's button functions
data.body:
Overview: the buttons on a controller are not responding to their assigned functions.

Forum post: I discovered that when deploying to the Nvidia SHIELD tablet, i can only assign (or register) the Atomic.CONTROLLER_BUTTON_A but when assigning it to be the jump button, it Works but only when pressing the touch area of the SHIELD controller o_O so i thought maybe you haven't assigned the correct button scheme to the corresponding button functions??? (like: when pressing the B button on a controller, the function (if programmed that way by the developer!) will trigger the Atomic.CONTROLLER_BUTOON_B function to do something! hope this doens't sound too confusing :) ) i just accidentally noticed this, and i have tried almost every other Atomic.CONTROLLER_BUTTON_(insert button name here :P) and the only one i could get to Work was the BUTTON_A which as mentioned only Works when pressing the touch area.
